messages: f71d17bc38430b6b309d5d15344be716 (16:31): I missed the whole discussion on why '$' was chosen as the subject modifier
f71d17bc38430b6b309d5d15344be716 (16:32): but "E:has-descendent(selector)" seems much more fitting to the existing pattern
f71d17bc38430b6b309d5d15344be716 (16:33): is there a strong reason to choose $ over that pattern?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:38): The people who invented selectors hate readability?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:38): wasn't part of the discussion though

f69d55844584e567962289a5226442b4 (16:42): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, question about opera. Do you plan to add text selection on page w/o mouse. i really <3 shift + arrows but want cursor to select text as in design mode too.

f71d17bc38430b6b309d5d15344be716 (16:54): sounds like an extension could be made for it, might require ugly off screen textarea hacks though
